jsongminer
Class MainMethods

java.lang.Object
  jsongminer.MainMethods

public class MainMethods
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds static methods that are called by the Main method of the Main class. These outline each of the primary processing tasks performed by jSongMiner.

static void aceXMLToTextAndQuit(java.lang.String file_path, boolean url_decode)
          Convert the given ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file to the type of text file output by jSongMiner, which is to say field names (misc_info info_type attribute values) are printed to odd lines and field values (misc_info element values) are printed to the following even lines.

MainMethods

public MainMethods()
Method Detail

parseAndTestCommandLineArgs

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseAndTestCommandLineArgs(java.lang.String[] args,
                                                                                               java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata)
Parses and validates the specified command line arguments. An informative error message is printed to standard error if the command line arguments are invalid. Also, an explanation of the acceptable command line arguments is printed to standard error if the command line arguments provided are incorrect. A lone flag of "-help" will print the valid command line arguments to standard out. Program execution is terminated if invalid command line arguments or "-help" are parsed. If the command line settings are valid, then the specified audio file path, song title, artist name and album title metadata are added to song_metadata if present.

Parameters:
args - The command line arguments to parse and validate.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
Returns:
The parsed command line arguments. The keys indicate the flags provided and the values indicate the values for the flags specified. Only flags that were present are included (i.e. optional flags are not included.

parseConfigurationFile

public static ConfigDataAndParser parseConfigurationFile()
Parse the configurations file at the default location or, if this fails, generate a new one with default configuration values. Any problems that occur are printed to standard error. Print a status update to standard out if appropriate.

Returns:
The parsed (or auto-generated) configurations.

updateConfigsBasedOnCommandLineArgs

public static java.lang.String[] updateConfigsBasedOnCommandLineArgs(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> command_line_args,
                                                                     ConfigDataAndParser configs,
                                                                     java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Update the given configuration settings basedon command line arguments. Note that these configuration changes are temporary (i.e. they are not saved). Also delete existing artist and/or album log files, if specified in the command line arguments.

Parameters:
command_line_args - The parsed command line arguments.
configs - The parsed configuration settings.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing is printed if this is null.
Returns:
An array of size 2 holding the paths of output files to save extracted metadata to based on overrides specified in the command line arguments. Element 0 corresponds to the ACE XML file output and Element 1 corresponds to the text file output. This array may not be null, but one or both of its entries may be null if the configuration settings and/or extracted data itself are to be used whether and where the data is to be saved.

parseAlreadyExtractedMetadata

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> parseAlreadyExtractedMetadata(java.lang.String already_accessed_file_path,
                                                                                                                boolean should_reextract,
                                                                                                                java.lang.String type_extracting,
                                                                                                                java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                                                                                                java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Set up file and data structure to note artists or albums for which metadata has already been extracted. Attempt to parse the contents from the corresponding file, and create an empty hash map if this cannot be done. Print status and error reports if appropriate.

Parameters:
already_accessed_file_path - The path of the Java serialized object containing the names and the metadata for artists albums that have already had their metadata extracted.
should_reextract - Whether or not metadata for the artist or album should be reextracted even if it has already been previously extracted.
type_extracting - The kind of metadata that is being extracted. Should be either "album" or "artist". Used for reporting purposes only.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Returns:
A HashMap with keys that correspond to artist or album names and values that correspond to vectors of extracted metadata. Is either empty or contains the values parsed from the specified file.

extractEmbeddedMetadata

public static EmbeddedTagMiner extractEmbeddedMetadata(java.lang.String to_extract_audio_path,
                                                       java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                                       java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Attempt to parse metadata from the specified audio file and store it.

Parameters:
to_extract_audio_path - The audio file to extract metadata from. Nothing will be done if this is null.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Returns:
An object containing the parsed embedded metadata. Null if no data could be parsed or if the specified file path is invalid.

getCandidateMetadataValue

public static java.lang.String getCandidateMetadataValue(EmbeddedTagMiner emb_miner,
                                                         java.lang.String audio_path,
                                                         boolean may_extract_embedded,
                                                         java.lang.String metadata_type_identifier,
                                                         java.lang.String model_value,
                                                         java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Returns the embedded metadata associated with the specified file (or the value specified in the model_value parameter, if any). This is not based on fingerprinting (fingerprinting is done later). If the model_value parameter is non-null, then its value is returned. If it is null, then embedded metadata extraction is attempted on the audio file referred to by the audio_file_path parameter. If this is succesful, the requested type of metadata (as set by the metadata_type_identifier parameter) is returned. If this is unsuccesful, then null is returned and an explanatory message is printed to error_stream.

Parameters:
emb_miner - An extractor for extracting embedded metadata for a specified file. Null if unavailable.
audio_path - The path of the audio file from which emb_miner extracted tags. Null if there is no such file. Is only used to see if there is such a file by testing if is null or not.
may_extract_embedded - Whether or not embedded metadata extraction is permitted (based on user settings).
metadata_type_identifier - The type of metadata to extract. May be either "artist" or "title".
model_value - The model metadata value. If this is non-null then it is considered to be more reliable than any embedded metadata, so it is returned.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Returns:
The requested typ of metadata, or null if it could not be found.

extractEchoNestSongID

public static java.lang.String extractEchoNestSongID(java.lang.String music_file_path,
                                                     java.lang.String model_song_title_metadata,
                                                     java.lang.String model_artist_metadata,
                                                     EchoNestMiner en_miner,
                                                     java.lang.String en_codegen_run_path,
                                                     java.lang.String en_codegen_directory,
                                                     java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                                     java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Attempt to extract the Echo Nest Song ID for the provided song using the most reliable methodology available. Three techniques are succesfively applied unitl one is succesful. The first is local fingerprinting, the second is remote fingerprinting and the third is embedded metadata-based identification. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

This method returns the Echo Nes Song ID as soon as one of these techniques is successful, and does not continue on to try other techniques unless the prior approaches did not work.

Parameters:
music_file_path - The path of the audio file to identify. Neither local nor remote fingerprinting will be performed if this is null.
model_song_title_metadata - The title of the song. Identification based on embedded metadata will not be performed if this is null.
model_artist_metadata - The "artist" of the song (typically refers to performer/band, although it is sometimes used to refer to composer, especially for classical music). This may be null if this information is unknown.
en_miner - The object performing Echo Nest data mining.
en_codegen_run_path - The path of the executable or script used to run it. Local fingerprinting will not be attempted if this is null. e.g. "./ENFP_Codegen.sh"
en_codegen_directory - The path of the directory holding the Echo Nest codegen fingerprinting binary. Local fingerprinting will not be attempted if this is null. e.g. "/home/ENMF/"
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Returns:
The Echo Nest Song ID for the given song.

matchToLastFMTrack

public static LastFMMiner matchToLastFMTrack(java.lang.String model_song_title_metadata,
                                             java.lang.String model_artist_metadata,
                                             java.lang.String last_fm_api_key,
                                             java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                             java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Prepare a LastFMMiner object to mine Last.FM. Set it to be associated with the song with the specified title and artist name. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

Parameters:
model_song_title_metadata - The believed title of the song. Identification will not be performed if this is null.
model_artist_metadata - The believed "artist" of the song (typically refers to performer/band, although it is sometimes used to refer to composer, especially for classical music). This may be null if this information is unknown.
last_fm_api_key - The Last.FM API key used to access Last.FM web services.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Returns:
A LastFMMiner associated with the specified song. Null if no association could be made.

storeIdentifyingMetadataOnly

public static void storeIdentifyingMetadataOnly(java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                                java.lang.String to_extract_audio_path,
                                                java.lang.String identifying_title,
                                                java.lang.String identifying_artist,
                                                java.lang.String identifying_album,
                                                java.lang.String en_song_id,
                                                LastFMMiner lfm_miner,
                                                boolean store_fails)
Store identifying information in the given Vector of MusicMetaData. Any information previously in this Vector is erased. The information stored is the song title, artist name, album title, audio file path, Echo Nest Song ID and Last.FM Track URL.

Parameters:
song_metadata - The vector to clear and store identifying metadata in.
to_extract_audio_path - The file path of the audio file that is being identified.
identifying_title - The title of the song.
identifying_artist - The name of the artist.
identifying_album - The title of the album.
en_song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID.
lfm_miner - The object storing metadata for a track.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that was not extracted (i.e. for each of the above parameters that is null) an indication is added to song_metadata. If this is false then fields could not be extracted are simply ignored.

extractEchoNestMetadata

public static void extractEchoNestMetadata(java.lang.String en_song_id,
                                           java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                           java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                           java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> artist_metadata_so_far,
                                           boolean store_fails,
                                           EchoNestMiner en_miner,
                                           java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                           java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Extract all available song and, if appropriate, artist metadata for the specified Echo Nest Song ID from the Echo Nest API. Adds the extracted metadata to the two Vector parameters of this method, respectively. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

Song metadata is always extracted. Artist metadata is only extracted if it has not already been extracted for the given artist during the processing of another song, as indicated by the presence of the artist's name (in lower case) in the artist_metadata_so_far parameter. Note that this method does not update this hash map in any way, and it is left to the calling object to do this.

Parameters:
en_song_id - The Echo Nest Song ID of the song to extract metadata for. Null if no association could be made with a particular song, in which case no extraction is attempted.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata_so_far - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist names (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding artist metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and artist extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Echo Nest API an indication is added to the stored MusicMetaData highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
en_miner - The object that performs the actual mining of the Echo Nest.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.

extractLastFMMetadata

public static void extractLastFMMetadata(LastFMMiner lfm_miner,
                                         java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                         java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                         java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> album_metadata,
                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> artist_metadata_so_far,
                                         java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> album_metadata_so_far,
                                         boolean store_fails,
                                         java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                         java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Extracts all available song and, if appropriate, artist and album metadata from the Last.FM API for the song stored in it. Adds the extracted metadata to the Vector parameters of this method. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

Song metadata is always extracted. Artist and album metadata are only extracted if they have not already been extracted for the given artist or album (respectively) during the processing of another song, as indicated by the presence of the artist's name (in lower case) in the artist_metadata_so_far parameter, or the album's title (in lower case) in the album_metadata_so_far parameter, respectively. Note that this method does not update either of these hash maps in any way, as it is left to the calling object to do this.

Parameters:
lfm_miner - A LastFMMiner associated with a particular specified song. Null if no association could be made with a particular song, in which case no extraction is attempted.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
album_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the album associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata_so_far - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist names (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding artist metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and artist extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
album_metadata_so_far - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist names (converted to lower case), and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding artist metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This parameter may be null, in which case it is ignored and artist extraction happens automatically. Also, the values may be null, in order to save space and processing for the calling object, but this has no effect on this method, as only the keys are used.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted from the Last.FM API an indication is added tothe stored MusicMetaData data highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a problem occurs.

storeEmbeddedMetadata

public static void storeEmbeddedMetadata(EmbeddedTagMiner emb_miner,
                                         java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                         boolean store_fails,
                                         java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                         java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
Stores all available song metadata extracted from the metadata embedded in an audio file. Adds the extracted metadata to the Vector parameter of this method. Prints status or error messages as appropriate.

Parameters:
emb_miner - An object associated with a particular audio file containing metadata that has already been parsed from it. Null if embedded metadata could not be parased from the audio file, in which case no extraction is performed.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
store_fails - If this is true, then for each individual piece of metadata that cannot be extracted an indication is added tothe stored MusicMetaData data highlighting the failure. If this is false then fields that cannot be extracted are simply ignored. Note that this parameter has no effect on song identification specifically.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An informative exception is thrown if a problem occurs.

prepareDublinCore

public static void prepareDublinCore(boolean include_unqualified_dublin_core,
                                     boolean include_qualified_dublin_core,
                                     boolean include_other_metadata_with_dublin_core,
                                     boolean repress_unqualified_artist_and_album,
                                     java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                     java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                     java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> album_metadata,
                                     java.io.PrintStream status_stream)
Process the provided song, artist and album metadata in order to produce versions of the metadata formatted using the Dublin Core standard, including unqualified and/or qualified Dublin Core. The user may also opt to delete the original metadata after this is done, based on the include_other_metadata_with_dublin_core configuration setting. The three provided Vectors are altered to hold the results. Note that the Dublin Core MusicMetaData objects will have "" for in their source fields. Note also that if the repress_unqualified_artist_and_album parameter is true that unqualified artist and album Dublin Core data will not be produced even if doing so is possible (this has no effect on qualified Dublin Core).

Parameters:
include_unqualified_dublin_core - Whether or not to interperet the metadata into unqualified DC.
include_qualified_dublin_core - Whether or not to interperet the metadata into qualified DC.
include_other_metadata_with_dublin_core - Whether or not to delete the original contents of the three provided vectors after the DC data has been produced.
repress_unqualified_artist_and_album - Whether or not to produce unqualified DC metadata for artists and albums (even if the data is available).
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
album_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the album associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.

saveData

public static void saveData(boolean as_ace_xml,
                            java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                            java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                            java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> album_metadata,
                            boolean package_song_artist_album,
                            java.lang.String songs_save_directory,
                            java.lang.String artists_save_directory,
                            java.lang.String albums_save_directory,
                            boolean url_encode_output,
                            java.lang.String save_file_path,
                            java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                            java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Save all of the just-extracted Echo Nest and Last.FM metadata for the song and, if apprpropriate, artist and album, in either a text file where each odd line is a field identifier and each even line is the value for the field named on the preceding line, or as an ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file. Song, artist and album data may each saved be in its own auto-named file, or it may be saved in separate files, depending on the package_song_artist_album parameter. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

Each ACE XML 1.1 Classifications File is saved to contain a single instance with all of the MusicMetaData objects saved as misc_info. The instance identifier is found based on the the provided identifier_keys (see code listing), and this identifier is used to auto-generate the file name. If a file with the selected name already exists, then an underscore followed by a numerical value is appended to the end of the file name such that the name is unique.

Parameters:
as_ace_xml - If this is true, then the data is saved as ACE XML. If it is false, then it is saved as txt.
song_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
artist_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the artist associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
album_metadata - A Vector of metadata already extracted for the album associated with this song. May not be null, but may be empty.
package_song_artist_album - Whether or not to package the song, artist and album metadata in the above three parameters into a single file. If this is true, then all of this metadata is saved in a single file in the songs_save_directory. If it is false then files may also be saved in the artists_save_directory and albums_save_directory directories.
songs_save_directory - The directory to save the ACE XML song file in. The file name itself will be auto-generated based on the file's contents.
artists_save_directory - The directory to save the ACE XML artist file in. The file name itself will be auto-generated based on the file's contents. Ignored if package_song_artist_album is true.
albums_save_directory - The directory to save the ACE XML album file in. The file name itself will be auto-generated based on the file's contents. Ignored if package_song_artist_album is true.
url_encode_output - Whether or not to URL encode (UTF-8) the saved data. If this is true, the file name will also be URL encoded.
save_file_path - The path of the single file to save metadata extraction results to. Ignored if null. If it is non-null, then it overrides all other settings.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.

updateAlreadyAccessedLog

public static void updateAlreadyAccessedLog(java.lang.String already_accessed_file_path,
                                            java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> metadata_so_far,
                                            java.lang.String identifying_artist,
                                            java.lang.String identifying_album,
                                            java.io.PrintStream status_stream,
                                            java.io.PrintStream error_stream)
Update and save either the artists or albums already extracted log. Note that the metadata saved for each artist or album here is null, as at this point only the keys (i.e. artist names or album titles in lower case) are needed in the hash map to check if metadata has already been extracted for an artist or album, and the artist or album metadata itself is saved elsewhere. Print status or error messages as appropriate.

Parameters:
already_accessed_file_path - The path to save the updated hash map to.
metadata_so_far - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist or album names, and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding extracted metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This may not be null.
identifying_artist - The name of the artist that is being added to the log. Null if this update is to albums instead of artists. If this is not null, then identifying_album must be.
identifying_album - The name of the album that is being added to the log. Null if this update is to artists instead of albums. If this is not null, then identifying_artist must be.
status_stream - To print status updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.
error_stream - To print error updates to. Nothing printed if this is null.

printMetadata

public static void printMetadata(java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> song_metadata,
                                 java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> artist_metadata,
                                 java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> album_metadata,
                                 boolean package_song_artist_album)
Print all song, artist and album metadata just extracted to standard out.

Parameters:
song_metadata - The song metadata just extracted. May be empty, but not null.
artist_metadata - The artist metadata just extracted. May be empty, but not null.
album_metadata - The album metadata just extracted. May be empty, but not null.
package_song_artist_album - If this is true, then song, artist and album metadata are output as a single list. If it is false, then they are each output as a separate list.

readArtistsOrAlbumsExtracted

public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> readArtistsOrAlbumsExtracted(java.lang.String file_path)
Parses a HashMap< String, Vector > from the specified Java serialized object. This hash map has keys that correspond to artist or album names and values that correspond to vectors of corresponding extracted metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs.

Parameters:
file_path - The file path to read the hash map from.
Returns:
The parsed hash map. Null is returned if it could not be parsed.

writeArtistsOrAlbumsExtracted

public static void writeArtistsOrAlbumsExtracted(java.lang.String file_path,
                                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData>> metadata_so_far,
                                                 java.lang.String new_key_id,
                                                 java.util.Vector<MusicMetaData> new_metadata)
                                          throws java.lang.Exception
Saves given metadata_so_far as a serialized Java object to file_path, after having added a new_metadata entry for new_key_id to it.

Parameters:
file_path - The path to save the updated hash map to.
metadata_so_far - A hash map whose keys correspond to artist or album names, and whose values correspond to vectors of corresponding extracted metadata. The contents are based on the processing of previous songs. This may not be null.
new_key_id - The artist or album name of a new artist of album to add to metadata_so_far. Nothing will be added to the hash map if this is null.
new_metadata - The metadata for the artist artist or album referred to by new_key_id. This may be null, in which case a new entry will still be added to the hash map for new_key_id, but the value for this key will be null.
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - An exception is thrown if the file cannot be written.

urlDecodAndQuit

public static void urlDecodAndQuit(java.lang.String to_decode)
URL-decode (using UTF-8) the given string and print it to standard out. Then terminate execution. If a problem occurs, a notification is printed to standard error.

Parameters:
to_decode - The string to decode.

aceXMLToTextAndQuit

public static void aceXMLToTextAndQuit(java.lang.String file_path,
                                       boolean url_decode)
Convert the given ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file to the type of text file output by jSongMiner, which is to say field names (misc_info info_type attribute values) are printed to odd lines and field values (misc_info element values) are printed to the following even lines. This is output to standard out. URL decoding may or may not be performed, depending on the url_decode parameter. Executino ends after this is complete. If a problem occurs, a notification is printed to standard error.

Parameters:
file_path - The path of the ACE XML 1.1 Classifications file to translate.
url_decode - Whether or not to URL decode the results (UTF-8)
